snippet: An investigator appointed to look into Charles K. Edwards’s time as inspector general says there was no evidence he had awarded contracts to unqualified companies or destroyed telephone records.
abstract: Report prepared by special federal investigator paints former Homeland Security Dept inspector general Charles K Edwards as sloppy executive and raises questions about whether he violated federal nepotism laws; clears Edwards of wrongdoing on 13 other accusations.
lead_paragraph: An investigator appointed to look into Charles K. Edwards’s time as inspector general says there was no evidence he had awarded contracts to unqualified companies or destroyed telephone records.

headline.main: Report Offers Mixed View of Ex-Watchdog at Department of Homeland Security
headline.print_headline: Report Offers Mixed View of Watchdog at Agency
